space-launch-vr.name: Space Launch VR
space-launch-vr.summary: A student led project developed for the first rocket launch from UK soil - in collaboration with Spaceport Cornwall and Virgin Orbit.

sections.heading: About the Project
sections.description: Space Launch VR is a project designed to highlight the work which goes into making a space flight work. Virgin Orbit partnered with Spaceport Cornwall to launch a rocket from UK soil. This led to my team getting funding to develop their idea of having a digital gallery which could teach children about space. This project gives in-depth tours and talks from those involved in the First Rocket Launch from UK soil.

sections.heading: My Role
sections.description: As a programmer, my role within the project was to create new and optimise existing code. When I joined, the primary goal was to ensure the project would run on the Meta Quest 2. This involved debugging and optimising code as well as scenes within Unity. As a small team, I had my hand in a lot of different systems across the game.

sections.heading: Showcases
sections.description: We exhibited the game a variety of times at a handful of events, including Goonhilly 60, an event in Kensington as well as other various events around the country.

sections.heading: In the News
sections.description:
Checkout these articles for information on the project:
Falmouth University create 'space for everyone' with launch of Spaceport VR experience
Mission Possible: Falmouth students unveil VR rocket launch experience

sections.heading: Where to Play
sections.description:
Unfortunately, the launch was unsuccessful following a fuel filter malfunction. However, you can still experience the project on Oculus Quest 2 or Quest Pro.

Play Now via the Oculus Store

flight-attendant-simulator.name: Flight Attendant Simulator
flight-attendant-simulator.summary: Learning how to implement VR into Unity in a team of 3 Artists and 1 Programmer.
flight-attendant-simulator.description:
Play as a flight attendant aboard a private jet, hand out food to customers and make sure they are satisfied. In this fast-paced VR experience, the wrong order could be a matter of life or death. Only time will tell if you’re up to the challenge.
PLAY NOW (itch.io)

sections.heading: About
sections.description: Flight Attendant Simulator is a VR experience made in Unity and C# over the course of 6 months during my final year of Game Design at Priestley College. I was the sole programmer for the project in a team of 4 - with the other 3 members being artists.

sections.heading: My Role
sections.description: As the sole programmer, my role entailed working on all technical aspects of the game. This involved the implementation of mechanics, debugging of code and placement of assets within Unity. The project utilised SteamVR for its VR integration - allowing it to theoretically work on all Desktop VR headsets, however, this was only tested on the Oculus Rift CV1 headset.

sections.heading: Controls
sections.description: The image here showcases the controls within the game.

sections.heading: Reflection
sections.description: The game itself is probably one of my proudest. We worked hard to complete what we did and managed out time and scope effectively for the game. Working on this game created a level of

sections.description: Check out Flight Attendant Simulator at the link below:

gruttel-scuttle.name: Gruttel Scuttle
gruttel-scuttle.summary: Making a unique, fast paced colony management/strategy game in a team of 15 people.

sections.heading: About The Game
sections.description:
Welcome to the planet of Holmfen, home to the ditzy, newt-like gruttels!
Interact with and manage a colony of gruttels as they clean their rubbish-filled home. Select which gruttels you will bring on your cleaning excursions. Feed them Nana Betsy ready meals to power them up, throughout the level. Direct the gruttels to the rubbish and back to their recycling machines, snapping them out of any distractions. Be careful as when the rubbish starts to pile up, so do the gruttels' stress levels! Manage their stress until the timer runs out the successfully clean Holmfen!

sections.heading: My Role
sections.description: As a programmer, my primary role is to create new and maintain existing code within any game which I work on. Gruttel Scuttle is no exception. I implemented a variety of mechanics across this game, primarily focused on ensuring that designers could easily implement and interface with the mechanics I had created. I worked alongside two other programmers in this endeavour.

sections.heading: Where to Play
sections.description: Check out Gruttel Scuttle at the link below:
